intro: Clidemia subseriata, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its hairy, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of native forests. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Clidemia subseriata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats, which can impact native vegetation.
